Description: Omphalos of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: omphalos glazed black with rosette and rings in added red and white; exterior: reserved with brown bands.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 101, no. 305.5, pl. XXXII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2014) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 211, no. 11)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4646 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
